HColorView

HColorView is a simple box component that display its HColorValue as the color of the box.  Its default usage model is to specify an function reference with <setAction>.  That function will be called with the HColorValue bound to the HColorView whenever the HColorView is clicked.

Extends

HControl

Summary
HColorView
HColorView is a simple box component that display its HColorValue as the color of the box.
mouseDown
Call the action of the component with the valueObj as an parameter.
setValue
If a HColorValue object is given as the value, the background is set accordingly.

mouseDown

Call the action of the component with the valueObj as an parameter.  The purpose is to give the selected color to a function that actually does something with it.  The receiving action could be, for example, a setValueObj method of a component that handles colors.

See also

HControl.action HControl.setAction

setValue

setValue: function(_colorArr)

If a HColorValue object is given as the value, the background is set accordingly.
Generated by Natural Docs
ColorValues are HValue extensions used to support the special type of value with special xml output and internal representanion as a fixed size array.
setValue: function(_colorArr)
If a HColorValue object is given as the value, the background is set accordingly.
Abstract foundation class for all active visual components that implement events and values.
A function reference to call in certain situations.
setAction: function(_action)
Actions are specified as function calls to components.
